page.title: 18Water treatment in Strensham
page.content: There are 24 pre-treatment tanks which are primarily designed to reduce ammonia, manganese, various metals, detergents and organic pollutants through biological action within the sludge. Small doses of aluminium sulphate and lime can be added to the tank inlets if required. At the outlets of these tanks the water is divided into three groups of sedimentation tanks, at this point the main aluminium sulphate and chlorine doses are added, water is passed upward through sedimentation tanks to allow suspended solids to settle, and are drawn off automaticaly using sludge cones. The settled water is decanted into troughs and primary chlorination takes place, it then passes through filters with a media of anthracite, sand and gravel.
